results.title: The Living goddess
results.creator_credit: Frank Heimans, Josette Heimans, Australian Film Commission and Cinetel Productions
results.brief_description: Kumari, a virgin girl-child is installed as a deity in Nepal, and wields more power among her people than almost any other living person. Shows ceremonial and religious pageant of her accession in Nepal. Written and narrated by Paul Ricketts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Heimans, Josette Heimans, Australian Film Commission and Cinetel Productions

results.title: The Living gallery
results.brief_description: Recreation for children and adults is a problem for every community. The Art Gallery of Toronto provides many activities in addition to the usual tours and conducted parties. For children there are classes in art, hobby work, story-telling and other creative projects. Art becomes more than gazing at pictures.

results.title: The Living Forest (Captioned)
results.brief_description: As populations expand so do the demands being made on forests to provide living space and forest products. If the forest is to continue to supply our needs, what are the appropriate measures required to conserve it? This program is a detailed study of the ecology of a eucalypt forest and the many plants and animals which make up the forest community.

results.title: The Living forest
results.creator_credit: Christopher Parsons, Suzanne Gibbs and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World around us”.
The New Forest stands at the crossroads. For 900 years it has remained relatively unspoiled, providing a refuge for shyer animals such as badgers, deer and foxes. But the combined pressures of thousands of visitors keen to “get back to nature” plus the harvesting of trees are threatening the forest’s very existence.

results.title: The Lives of stars
results.creator_credit: David P. Stone and Coastal Community Colleges
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Universe: the infinite frontier: an introductory astronomy telecourse”.
A star is a heavenly body which retains its shape and radiates energy. This energy comes from nuclear reactions taking part in the star as it forms. Direct or close observation of the workings of a star is impossible so models have to be constructed to determine how they function. Neutrinos, sub-atomic particles created in the core of the sun, provide the answer to understanding the birth of stars. Explains how the luminosity of a star and its mass are closely related and looks at types of stars including the brown dwarf and red giant.

results.title: The Lively art of picture books (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Joanna Foster and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: Discusses the creation of picture books for children through interviews with artists Robert McCloskey, Barbara Cooney and Maurice Sendak. Shows examples of kinds of pictures used, various interpretations of the same subjects, and three complete picture books.
results.description: Discusses the creation of picture books for children through interviews with artists Robert McCloskey, Barbara Cooney and Maurice Sendak. Shows examples of kinds of pictures used, various interpretations of the same subjects, and three complete picture books.

results.title: The Littlest angel
results.brief_description: From the story by American children’s author, Charles Tazewell. A series of animated sketches are used to illustrate the well-known story of the littlest angel in Paradise who gave a simple wooden box containing a stone, a dog-collar and a pressed butterfly as his offering to celebrate the birth of the Christ-child. His gift is transformed by God into the Star of Bethlehem.

results.title: The Littlest ambassador
results.brief_description: The story of Rene Simard, aged 13, who visits Japan as a French-Canadian pop singer. Commentary paraphrases his spoken impressions and replies to questions. Includes scenes from the 3rd Tokyo Music Festival where Rene represents Canada and finally wins grand prize. Cameos by Frank Sinatra and Shirley Bassey.
